alert.note: Alert for Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 11 at 2:44AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER RETURNS TO NORTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO TONIGHT... A fast moving winter system arrives into northeastern NM late this evening, spreading through the eastern plains past midnight. Snow rates will increase near the midnight hour and will persist into Saturday morning. Moderate snow accumulations of two to four inches are forecast through the northeast highlands along I-25 from Las Vegas to Raton with locally higher amounts up to six inches from Raton Pass to Capulin. Slick winter travel conditions and periods of reduced visibility are likely during this event from the midnight hour to the early morning travel period. Conditions look to steadily improve past sunrise through the end of the morning. For the latest road conditions visit nmroads.com or dial 5-1-1.

area.areaDesc: Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Northeast Highlands
